content.rendered:
Roaming inside a college campus while bunking the class, sitting around friends in the garden, attending lectures to sleep peacefully, and all such things are now nothing but just memories is what this pandemic has changed. Now, when someone asks: When did the pandemic start showing its effect? 9 months ago. When did you go out last time? 9 months ago. When did you play any outdoor sports? 9 months ago? When was the last time there were no restrictions for roaming around the city? 9 months ago. How much time does it take to make a new human? 9 months. When was the last time you were happy in life? Maybe recently, a minute, a day a week, a month, or a year ago. One thing the pandemic could not change is our habit of finding happiness in our lives because along with the pandemic we changed our ways of finding happiness too. 

The pandemic hit hard for sure, but we learned our hard lessons too. We started filling the void growing within us for years now. The void was filled simply by taking things for granted. By not taking someone’s presence for granted, having food in our stomach for granted, a cozy sleep in our bed for granted, we all started to fill the voids inside of us that was created by taking such, many little things for granted all these years. This is the very first lesson which this pandemic forced me to pen in my dairy and soul. Do not take little things in your life for granted, the way I took the chance to say my first hello to a known stranger1. for granted, and now that first hello is still pending. (Probably never happening. No, the person is not dead!)

This pandemic made us feel sorry and regretful for a lot of things for sure, but we also learned to show some gratitude in our lives. Saying no to a trip to Goa with friends by using “Abba nahi manenge” as an excuse is still the biggest regret of my topper friend, (He didn’t even mention about the trip to his father for once.) and yet he is still thankful that he is alive and can go to Goa anytime in the upcoming years. This time he would even take the risk of going a week before the exams because he learned that having low scores is better than the BIGGEST regret one can ever have in college life. All I’m saying is show gratitude for things you have while you have the time, or else you will regret your entire life for that. Gratitude makes our character calm. This is the second and the most important thing this pandemic taught us. 

Now, you might be wondering what is the third thing this pandemic taught. Well, there’s nothing. It’s just that this pandemic helped me to get back to that writer for my therapy sessions. Writing makes me feel relieved of all the worries. That’s how I managed to survive this pandemic mentally. How did you manage to live? Doesn’t matter because if you are reading this you somehow managed to survive.

In the end, Pen-demically2 I survived through this pandemic so far.

1. A known stranger is a person none other than your crush. 

2. Pen-demically: (adverb) Surviving a pandemic by using writing as a therapy for mental health. 

 

From a diary named Mirror,

Optimus Prime

excerpt.rendered: Roaming inside a college campus while bunking the class, sitting around friends in the garden, attending lectures to sleep peacefully, and all such things are now nothing but just memories is what this pandemic has changed. Now, when someone asks: When did the pandemic start showing its effect? 9 months ago. When did you go […]

content.rendered:
Rushit Gabani

CH 1st sem

Maitrayee Khatri

MBBS 2nd Year

1st January, 2020

Midnight. Songs blaring at deafening volume. Bodies flailing in the air. Hearts Thumping. And a burger. That night, the unforgiving winter breeze couldn’t reach us. We were too busy dancing till we drop. It wasn’t an EDM fest, just twenty girls in a hostel compound and a speaker with fancy lights in it. Either way, it wouldn’t have made the tiniest difference, because all the people that mattered were right there with me. Wasn’t that the last time we yelled our souls out? Wasn’t that the last time we sung like no one was listening?

5th March, 2020

Didn’t we decide to eat at that new place like tens of hundreds of time? Yet, we went off to that same little shop and ate that very familiar dosa. That night, we strolled across the city for hours and laughed at the most ridiculous jokes like drunk idiots. Wasn’t that the last time we ever did such a thing?

16th March, 2020

The 7 day vacation was announced. An ordinary bunch of college students transmuted into a bunch of hooligans who couldn’t believe what they heard.  Wasn’t that the last time, a holiday felt like a holiday?

17th March, 2020

The day we had to head back to home. I bought my friend’s train ticket to repay an old debt. Wasn’t that the last time I owed a friend some money? Never in my life had I missed a train, but that day was different. Three of us were waiting at the station for an hour, and yet somehow, we managed to miss a train. It delayed our arrival back to home by three hours. That extra time was the best accidental gift I ever received.

And that was it. The day everything would change. In the two years I spent at college, there were many things we didn’t do, many plans that were left unrealized, but I don’t regret any of it like I thought I would. I realized that I got to live a life, many could only dream of. This year, I’ve felt gratefulness like never before. I realized the great significance of things I took for granted. I feared change, several times I wished for time to just freeze in its track. But the great shift this year brought made me realize I will never fear change again. Because all the great moments I lived will never change. They’re immutable, constant and mine forever. Carved into my mind, and impossible to forget. I will always be dancing, I will always hold hands on a long walk, I will always be on that train, and I will always be grateful for this beautiful life.

Khadija Sidhpuri

CE 6th Sem

That night, the unforgiving winter breeze couldn’t reach us. We were too busy dancing till we drop. It wasn’t an EDM fest, just twenty girls in a hostel compound and a speaker with fancy lights in […]

title.rendered: 2020- Especially Relatable to First Year Students

content.rendered:
This year passed fast with the blink of an eye,

Making some sweet and sour memories for all of us.

Half of the year went with the controversies regarding conduction of exams during pandemic situation,

But still it was also a passable experience.

It gave us all chance to spend time with family,

Playing indoor games and cherishing old memories.

It let us chill out with our school friends on beach,

Who might have been scattered to different places otherwise.

But the best part of the year was beginning of our college life,

Yes, we’ve all communicated with new faces and made friends online,

Which experience our seniors may not be able to define.

Hoping for the next year to bring more happiness in all our lives.

Keta Parikh

CH 1st Sem

It gave us all chance to spend time with family, Playing indoor […]

content.rendered:
છોડ વાવ્યા પછી આપણે એને એમ જ નથી મૂકી દેતા, એને પાણી પીવડાવ્યે છે, એને ખાતર આપીને તેનો ઉછેર કરીયે છે.. તેવી જ રીતેઆ સંબધોનું પણ એવું છે.. સંબધોમાં પણ સમયાંતરે હુંફ, સ્નેહ, લાગણી પૂરતા રહેવું જરૂરી છે.. હું મારા જ એક અનુભવની વાત કરું તો….

હું કેેમિમકલ એન્જિનિયરિંગના ત્રીજા વર્ષમાું અભ્યાસ કરતો એક વિદ્યાર્થી છું.. કોલેજમાં આવ્યા પછી હું ઘણા મિત્રોનાું સંપ<span “>ર્કમાં આવ્યો પરંતુ અમુક જ સંબંધો હોય છે જે કાયમના માટે રેશમના તાુંતણે બંધાય જાય છે, અને કાયમને માટે જિંદગીનો અમૂલ્ય ભાગ બનીને રહી જાય છે…

કોલેજના બીજા વર્ષમાં હું મારા એક અમિત પ્રજાપતિ નામનાં સિનિયરના સંપર્કમાં આવ્યો.. જે ખૂબ શાંત અને પ્રેમાળ છે.. અમે બે વર્ષ સુધી એક જ રૂમમાં સાથે રહ્યાં અને કોલેજકાળને સુવર્ણમય બનાવ્યો. જેણે મને એમના નાનાભાઈ કરતા પણ વધારે મને પ્રેમ આપ્યો છે..કોઈ પણ સંબંધ માટે સમજણ સૌથી વધારે મહત્વપુર્ણ છે..સામાજિકજ્ઞાન અને સમજણશક્તિનો વિશાળ ખજાનો એટલે અમિતભાઇ.. તેમની સાથેનો એક પ્રસંગ વર્ણન કરું તો…

એક દિવસ રાતે તેઓ ઓનલાઇન ફિલ્મ જોતા હતા , એમનું નેટ ખતમ થઈ ગયું હતું એટલે તેઓ વાઈ–ફાઈથી મારા મોબાઈલમાંથી નેટ વાપરતા હતા.. મારા મોંબાઇલમાંથી પણ ત્યારેજ તે દિવસનું નેટ વપરાય ગયું.. સવારે ઊઠીને જ્યારે મને આ વાતની ખબર પડી ત્યારે મારું મોં વિલું થઇ ગયું. આજે કોઈપણ સાથે આવી ઘટના બનેતો સ્વભાવિક છે કે હાલત થોડી ખરાબ થઈ જાય.. પરંતુ શું થાય, એ મારા સિનિયર, મોટાભાઈ સમાન એમને કાઈ કહી તો ના શક્યો પરંતુ આપણી આંખો અને ચહેરો ઘણું બોલી જાય છે.. જે અમિતભાઈ સમજી ગયા હતા.. સવારના સાડા નવથી સાંજના સાડા પાંચ વાગ્યા સુધી અમારે કોલેજ હોય છે.. સાુંજે કોલેજથી રૂમ પર આવીને એમણે મને ચોકલેટ આપી.. કોઈ કારણ વગર જ એમ જ ચોકલેટ આપી એટલે મેં એમને પુછ્યું ચોકલેટ શા માટે.., તો તેમણે કહ્યું કે સવારમાં તારા ચહેરા પર જે કડવાશ આવી ગઈ હતી એને મીઠાશમાં ફેરવવા અને અમે બંને હસી પડયા….

હું એવું માનતો હતો કે કોઈને ભેટ આપવી, ચોકલેટ આપવી એ માત્ર દેખાવો છે.. પરંતુ આ અનુભવ પછી ખબર પડી કે સંબંધોના માવઝત માટે આ પણ જરુરી છે..

કોલેજ કાળ એ સુવર્ણકાળ છે..આ સુવર્ણકાળમાંથી જિંદગીના એક નવા અધ્યાયમાં પ્રવેશ કરતાં તમામ મારા પ્યારા સીનીયરો ને હાર્દિક શુભેચ્છાઓ..

Vipul Bambhaniya

CH 6th Sem

excerpt.rendered: છોડ વાવ્યા પછી આપણે એને એમ જ નથી મૂકી દેતા, એને પાણી પીવડાવ્યે છે, એને ખાતર આપીને તેનો ઉછેર કરીયે છે.. તેવી જ રીતેઆ સંબધોનું પણ એવું છે.. સંબધોમાં પણ સમયાંતરે હુંફ, સ્નેહ, લાગણી પૂરતા રહેવું જરૂરી છે.. હું મારા જ એક અનુભવની વાત કરું તો…. હું કેેમિમકલ એન્જિનિયરિંગના ત્રીજા વર્ષમાું અભ્યાસ કરતો એક વિદ્યાર્થી છું.. […]

title.rendered: Beginning of something you always wanted

content.rendered:
“This is the beginning of something you always wanted”. 

The moment, where you put yourself up on the pedestal has come. Recall those assiduous efforts you have been putting since years which made you feel fidgety at nights, after going through that hectic college schedule and taking over hundred examinations, the time has come where you are ready to leave this place with a grin on your face but your heart still wants to loiter around the campus. 

Remember the day, how hesitant and shy you were, when professor asked you to introduce yourself to your classmates?!!

I’ve been slow in choosing friends, slowest in changing. Once the squad was ready, those long canteen conferences were always memorable- exams, rem, movies, food, crushes, travel plans, roasting the hot headed guy of the squad; everything was so special. There wasn’t a single topic which was left untouched.

 “Anything that happens for the first time, leaves an indelible mark on your mind”. 

No matter how many places you have been to, that first group trip will always have a special place in your heart.

 Stressed when spell backwards makes desserts; 

Who can forget those heart melting dessert dates with those special ones, which really proved to be a very good way to forget all your worries. Where you just concentrate in making the most out of those small meets.

Great friends, great places, and those sweet gestures and moments, after carrying all these memories with you, here you are, ready to leave this place with a grin on your face, but your heart still wants to loiter around the campus.

Kaushal Shukla

IC 2nd Sem

Recall those assiduous efforts you have been putting since years which made you feel fidgety at nights, after going through that hectic college schedule and taking over hundred examinations, the time has come where […]

content.rendered:
1st October 2019

I hope I tell you before you leave. 

It is going to be seven months since I met you first time in March for the flash mob. I kind of had a feeling during those days but I started telling myself that these are normal feelings I have when I see a new girl. Well, when the next semester began and when you passed by, the rumbling of leaves sounded like sweet music to me, the heartbeat became moderate but loud, the walk became slow and my eyes froze at your smile for a while. I was a bit perplexed whether you were smiling at me or I’m just assuming it like I always do. And then I realised the feeling turned out to be different, something special. A ‘Hi’ is what I have been trying to say for three months till now. I’m just too scared to say hello. Three months of passing by your class to find you to say hello, all those canteen visits during lunch breaks despite living in a hostel and all those exchanges of smiles when we crossed each other would go in vain and I never like my efforts to go in vain. On the other hand, I’m too scared to say hello. I wish that I can have a cup of coffee or tea with you on one fine evening while the sun is setting and a new dawn is about to come in our life, and I want to happen this before you leave. I just read a poem whose title goes like “Hey, that’s no way to say goodbye”. But I wonder would I even be able to say hello before you leave. Sometimes I think that am I too scared to say hello? Just a hello! I hope that there is any way in the world that you could hear the hello in my silence and a smile. A smile which might reflect the fear but I hope you will see past that fear and will see the love obscured behind the silence and the smile. I wish tomorrow morning I have that courage to tell you before you leave. This time I do not want to have any regrets by not telling it to you. A few days to go and this semester will come to an end partially which means we might not see each other again if I am not able to tell you about my feelings. I know deep down in your heart you know about my feelings. Before you leave, I want to at least have a proper goodbye because goodbyes remind us that we will meet again soon. For that, I have to first say hi and if I couldn’t say hi at least read it in my silence and the smile.

(From a diary named Mirror of Optimus Prime)

6th Sem
DDU
